content.text: is designed to process and archive spanned billing data for Con Edison gas meters. It handles cases where billing periods span multiple months, requiring the data to be split and processed accordingly. The procedure calculates various metrics such as therms and CCF (hundred cubic feet of gas) for each billing period, adjusts for meter rollovers, and inserts the processed data into a summary table.
This procedure is complex due to several factors:
It involves multiple calculations and adjustments for each billing period.
It uses a cursor to iterate over large datasets.
It involves several custom functions and calculations to determine billing metrics.
It handles edge cases like meter rollovers and spanned billing periods.
: This parameter is intended to return the status of the procedure execution. However, it is not used within the procedure, which be an oversight.
: The procedure begins by declaring a series of variables to hold data for processing each billing record.
is declared to iterate over records in the
is greater than 1, indicating spanned billing periods.
For each record, it retrieves necessary data such as account number, meter readings, and billing periods.
It calculates the total gas spanned billed percentage using a custom function.
It determines the number of periods minus one for pro-rating purposes.
It initializes counters and calculates therms using the CCF and therm factor.
: The procedure checks if the meter has rolled over and adjusts readings accordingly.
For each period, it calculates the monthly percentage, CCF, and therms.
It adjusts the meter readings for rollovers.
It determines the projected "ToDate" for the billing period.
It constructs a custom note explaining the parsing and original data.
: The processed data is inserted into the
: After the loop, it processes the last period's data, ensuring no rounding errors, and inserts the final data into the summary table.
: The cursor is closed and deallocated.
: The use of a cursor can lead to performance issues, especially with large datasets, as it processes rows one at a time.
: The procedure relies heavily on custom functions, which can add overhead if not optimized.
: The numerous calculations and conditional logic can impact performance, particularly if the dataset is large.
output parameter is not utilized, which could lead to confusion or errors in calling applications expecting a status update.
: The use of a cursor can be inefficient and may lead to performance bottlenecks.
: There is no explicit error handling within the procedure, which could lead to unhandled exceptions and data integrity issues.
: The logic for handling meter rollovers is complex and may not cover all edge cases, potentially leading to incorrect data processing.
: The procedure relies on several custom functions, which are not visible here. Any issues or inefficiencies in these functions could affect the procedure's performance and accuracy.

CREATE PROCEDURE [ConEd].[Archive_usp_ParseSpannedBilledUploadConEdisonMeterInfo] (@Status int output)
AS
BEGIN
	SET NOCOUNT ON;
	
	DECLARE @UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpannedSeqid AS dbo.seqid, @Notes AS dbo.notes
		,@AccountNumber AS dbo.acctnum, @TariffCode AS dbo.tariff, @OriginalMeterNumber AS meternumber 
		,@GasRateCode AS GasRateCode, @MeterFromReading AS MeterReadingNumber7
		,@MeterToReading AS MeterReadingNumber7, @MeterConstant AS MeterConstantMultiplier 
		,@ReadingCode AS ReadingCode, @NumberOfDials AS MeterDials, @NumberOfPeriodsMinusOne AS dbo.Accumulator
		,@DeltaNumberOfPeriods AS dbo.Accumulator, @BillingPeriod AS dbo.yyyymm, @FirstPeriodCanceled AS dbo.yyyymm
		,@ThermFactor AS dbo.ThermsFactor, @BillingPeriodRevision AS dbo.yyyymm, @FromDate AS dbo.yyyymmdd 
		,@ToDate AS dbo.yyyymmdd, @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision AS dbo.yyyymm, @CalculatedFromDate AS dbo.yyyymmdd 
		,@CalculatedToDate AS dbo.yyyymmdd, @Therms AS dbo.EnergyUnit, @CCF AS dbo.EnergyUnit 
		,@CCFAverage AS dbo.EnergyUnit, @SumAverageCCF AS dbo.EnergyUnit, @idx AS INT
		,@MeterRolloverAdjustmentFactor AS INT, @NumberOfDialsAdjustmentFactor AS INT, @MeterHasRolledOver AS BIT
		,@ThermsMonthlyLastPeriod AS dbo.EnergyUnit, @CCFMonthlyLastPeriod AS dbo.EnergyUnit
		,@CalculatedMeterFromReading AS INT, @CalculatedMeterToReading AS INT, @CalculatedMeterConstant AS DECIMAL(7, 1)
		,@ConEdUtilityCode AS dbo.seqid = 9, @ApplyMonthlyPercentage AS dbo.DiscountPercentage
		,@ThermsMonthlySum AS dbo.EnergyUnit, @ThermsMonthly AS dbo.EnergyUnit, @CCFMonthly AS dbo.EnergyUnit 
		,@CCFMonthlySum AS dbo.EnergyUnit, @TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage AS dbo.DiscountPercentage
		,@BillingCycle AS dbo.MonthlyBillingCycle = 'M', @BillingDate AS dbo.yyyymmdd;

	SELECT TOP (1) @BillingPeriod = BillingPeriod FROM ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeter;

	DECLARE SpannedGasBillCursor CURSOR FOR
	SELECT UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpannedSeqid FROM ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpanned 
	WHERE DeltaNumberOfPeriods > 1
	OPEN SpannedGasBillCursor;
	FETCH NEXT FROM SpannedGasBillCursor INTO @UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpannedSeqid
	WHILE @@FETCH_STATUS = 0
	BEGIN
		SELECT @AccountNumber = AccountNumber,
			@OriginalMeterNumber = MeterNumber,
			@MeterFromReading = ISNULL(FromReading, 0),
			@MeterToReading = ISNULL(ToReading, 0),
			@MeterConstant = ISNULL(MeterConstant, 1),
			@ReadingCode = ReadingCode,
			@NumberOfDials = Dials,
			@DeltaNumberOfPeriods = DeltaNumberOfPeriods, 
			@BillingPeriodRevision = BillingPeriodRevision,
			@FirstPeriodCanceled = FirstPeriodCanceled, 
			@FromDate = FromDate,
			@ToDate = ToDate, 
			@CCF = CCF, 
			@ThermFactor = ThermFactor,
			@BillingPeriod = BillingPeriod
		FROM ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpanned
		WHERE UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpannedSeqid = @UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpannedSeqid;
	
	--	Aggregate the average City wide monthly gas usage percentage for the spanned row billing periods 
	SELECT @TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage = dbo.CalculateTotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage(@BillingCycle
		,@DeltaNumberOfPeriods, @FirstPeriodCanceled, @BillingPeriodRevision);
	
	--	Determine the number of periods minus 1 to pro-rate the money and usage.  The last period will derive the money and usage
	--	by row totals - (the n-1 aggregates of money and usage)
	SET @NumberOfPeriodsMinusOne = @DeltaNumberOfPeriods-1;
	
	--	Initialize the counters for the n-1 parses
	SELECT @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision = @FirstPeriodCanceled
		,@CalculatedFromDate = @FromDate, @CalculatedToDate = @ToDate, @idx = 0
		,@ThermsMonthlySum = 0, @CCFMonthlySum = 0
		,@CalculatedMeterFromReading = CAST(@MeterFromReading AS INT)
		,@CalculatedMeterToReading = CAST(@MeterToReading AS INT)
		,@CalculatedMeterConstant = CAST(@MeterConstant AS DECIMAL(7, 1));

	--
	SELECT @ThermFactor = dbo.DetermineConEdisonGetThermFactorFromAccountTable(@AccountNumber, @BillingPeriodRevision)
		,@GasRateCode = dbo.DetermineConEdisonGetGasTariffRateFromAccountTable(@AccountNumber, @BillingPeriodRevision)
		,@BillingDate = dbo.ConvertDatetimeToYYYYMMDD(dbo.DetermineConEdisonGetPostingDateFromAccountTable(@AccountNumber, @BillingPeriodRevision));
	
	SET @Therms = Round(@CCF * @ThermFactor, 0);
	
	set @NumberOfDialsAdjustmentFactor = CASE 
											-- Standard Gas meter has from 3 to 6 dials.  
											when 2 < @NumberOfDials and @NumberOfDials < 7 
											then Cast (@NumberOfDials AS int)
											-- If there are no dials reported or the number of dials is outside the 
											-- range of the standard number of dials (3 to 6 dials).  The sum of the 
											-- MeterFromReading + total CCF will derive a number that is equal to the 
											-- number of dials - 1 raised to the power of 10 plus the MeterToReading.
											else len(CAST(@CCF+@CalculatedMeterFromReading AS VARCHAR(7)))-1
										 END;
	SELECT @MeterHasRolledOver = 0, @MeterRolloverAdjustmentFactor = POWER(10, @NumberOfDialsAdjustmentFactor);

	IF (@CalculatedMeterToReading < @CalculatedMeterFromReading
		OR POWER(10, @NumberOfDialsAdjustmentFactor) < = @CCF)
	BEGIN
		SET @MeterHasRolledOver = 1;
	END;
	
	WHILE(@NumberOfPeriodsMinusOne > @idx)
	BEGIN
		-- The @ApplyMonthlyPercentage holds the weigthed average for the particular month
		select @ApplyMonthlyPercentage = dbo.[CalculateApplyMonthlyPercentageGasSpannedBilled] (@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,@TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage)
			
		-- Apply the Monthly Percentage to the meter reading and derive the CCF, Therms  and accumulate the weigthed average units.
		set @CCFMonthly = ROUND(@CCF * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,0)
		set @CCFMonthlySum = @CCFMonthlySum + @CCFMonthly
		set @ThermsMonthly = ROUND(@Therms * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,0)
		set @ThermsMonthlySum = @ThermsMonthlySum + @ThermsMonthly
			
		--	The CCF, Therms and Meter To Reading are derived.  The CCF
		set @CalculatedMeterToReading = @CalculatedMeterFromReading + round(@CCFMonthly/@CalculatedMeterConstant,0)
		set @CalculatedMeterToReading = case when @MeterHasRolledOver = 0 then @CalculatedMeterToReading 
												else 
												-- 
												-- The spanned meter reading has rolled over.  If the MeterToReading is less than @NumberOfDialsAdjustmentFactor then 
												-- the derived MeterToReading remains unadjusted. When the sum of the @CalculatedMeterFromReading + @CCFMonthly is greater
												-- than the @NumberOfDialsAdjustmentFactor is subtracted to make the adjustment for the rollover meter reset.
												-- 
												case when @CalculatedMeterToReading < @MeterRolloverAdjustmentFactor then @CalculatedMeterToReading
													else @CalculatedMeterToReading - @MeterRolloverAdjustmentFactor 
												end
										end
		--
		--	The Billing Period Projected "ToDate" is derived from the table "dbo.BillingPeriodProjected" using the utility company seqid and the
		--	RevisedBillingPeriod and using the "EndofPeriodTodate" AS the derived "Todate" for the account.
		--
		select @CalculatedToDate = dbo.[DetermineConEdisonBillingPeriodProjectedToDate](@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,@TariffCode,@ConEdUtilityCode)
		--
		print @AccountNumber+' '+@BillingPeriodRevision+' '+@FromDate+' '+@ToDate
		--
		--	Create a custom note that explains how the information was parsed and what was the original information of the spanned row.
		--	It will note in EC3 that the transaction was derived.
		--
		select @Notes = 'CalcTherm '+CAST(@Therms AS VARCHAR(10))+' = '+CAST(@ThermFactor AS VARCHAR(6))+' * '+CAST(@CCF AS VARCHAR(10))+
		' for '+CAST(@DeltaNumberOfPeriods AS VARCHAR(6))+' periods, First: '+@FirstPeriodCanceled +' ( '+@MeterFromReading+') Last: '+ 
		@BillingPeriodRevision +' ( '+@MeterToReading+'). '+' period: '+@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision+ ' Month %: '+CAST(@ApplyMonthlyPercentage AS VARCHAR(10))+
		' - Total %: '+CAST(@TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage AS VARCHAR(10))
		--
		--	INSERT the data into the table "ConEd.UploadConEdisonAccountSummary"
		--
		INSERT INTO ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary (
			AccountUtilityCompanySeqid,
			OriginalAccountNumber,
			OriginalMeterNumber,
			NumberOfTransactions, 
			NumberOfRebillTransactions,
			NumberOfCancelTransactions,
			BillingPeriod,
			BillingPeriodRevision,
			FirstCancelPeriod,
			BillingAction,
			InitialCancelFromDate,
			CurrentBillingToDate,
			GasRateCode,
			FromDate,
			ToDate,
			MeterFromReading,
			MeterToReading,
			Ccf,
			Therms,
			ThermsFactor,
			MeterConstant,
			TotalBillingDaysRebilled,
			NumberOfBillingPeriods,
			BillingDays,
			BillingDate,
			ReadingCode,
			NumberOfDials,
			MeterType,
			ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod,
			ProcessEffectiveDate,
			InitialPostingDate,
			AuthenticatedUserID,
			Notes,
			DerivedFromSpannedBill,
			SpannedBillingPeriodRevision,
			SpannedFirstCanceledBillingPeriod,
			SpannedCCF,
			SpannedThermFactor,
			SpannedTherm,
			SpannedMonthlyPercentage,
			SpannedTotalPercentage,
			EstimatedOrActualBilling,
			FacilityName,
			ServiceAddress)
		SELECT @ConEdUtilityCode,
			@AccountNumber,
			@OriginalMeterNumber, 
			1,-- NumberOfTransactions, 
			1,-- NumberOfRebillTransactions,
			0,-- NumberOfCancelTransactions,
			@BillingPeriod, 
			@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,
			@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,
			CASE WHEN @BillingPeriod = @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision THEN 'O' ELSE 'A' END,-- BillingAction, 
			@CalculatedFromDate,
			@CalculatedToDate,
			@GasRateCode,
			@CalculatedFromDate,
			@CalculatedToDate,
			CAST(@CalculatedMeterFromReading AS VARCHAR(7)),  --dbo.MeterReadingNumber
			CAST(@CalculatedMeterToReading AS VARCHAR(7)),  --dbo.MeterReadingNumber
			@CCFMonthly, 
			@ThermsMonthly,
			@ThermFactor,
			@MeterConstant,
			dbo.CalculateNumberOfBillingDays(@CalculatedFromDate,@CalculatedToDate), 
			1, 
			dbo.CalculateNumberOfBillingDays(@CalculatedFromDate,@CalculatedToDate),
			@BillingDate, 
			@ReadingCode,
			@NumberOfDials,
			'G', -- MeterType,
			'N', --ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod
			dbo.ConvertDateToYYYYMMDD (GETDATE()), -- ProcessEffectiveDate
			getDate(), -- InitialPostingDate
			1, --	AuthenticatedUserID,
			@Notes,
			'Y', -- DerivedFromSpannedBill
			@BillingPeriodRevision,  -- SpannedBillingPeriodRevision
			@FirstPeriodCanceled,  -- SpannedFirstPeriodCanceled
			@CCF,  -- SpannedCCF
			@ThermFactor,  -- SpannedThermFactor
			@Therms,  -- SpannedTherms
			@ApplyMonthlyPercentage,  -- SpannedApplyMonthlyPercentage
			@TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage,  -- SpannedTotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage
			--case when @ReadingCode < 15 then 'EST' else 'ACT' end, -- EstimatedOrActualBilling
			dbo.CalculateEstimatedOrActual(@ReadingCode,9),
			FacilityName,
			ServiceAddress
		FROM ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpanned
		WHERE UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpannedSeqid = @UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpannedSeqid; 
			
		--	Set up for the next the Revised Billing Period row.
		set @SumAverageCCF = @SumAverageCCF + @CCFAverage 	  
		set @idx = @idx + 1
			
		--	Calculate the next the Revised Billing Period row.
		select @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision = dbo.[CalculateNextBillingPeriod]  (@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,@BillingCycle)
			
		--	This will derive the new Revised Billing Period row's "FromDate"
		select @CalculatedFromDate = dbo.[DetermineConEdisonBillingPeriodProjectedFromDate](@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,@TariffCode,@ConEdUtilityCode)
			
		select @CalculatedMeterFromReading = @CalculatedMeterToReading 
		-- CAST(@CalculatedMeterFromReading AS dbo.MeterReadingNumber)
		--	Process the next Revised Billing Period row
		--
	END;
	
	--	Finish up the last period's processing
	--	Use the (Nth -1) periods @CalculatedToDate AS the "FromDate" and the acutal "ToDate" from the spanned record AS the "ToDate"
	select @CalculatedFromDate = @CalculatedToDate, @CalculatedToDate = @ToDate;
	
	--	Use the (Nth -1) periods Calculated Meter From Reading AS the "MeterFromReading" and the acutal "MeterToReading" from the spanned record AS the "MeterToReading"
	select @CalculatedMeterFromReading = @CalculatedMeterToReading 
	select @CalculatedMeterToReading = CAST(@MeterToReading AS int)
	
	--	@ApplyMonthlyPercentage is used for the notes purposes only
	select @ApplyMonthlyPercentage = dbo.[CalculateApplyMonthlyPercentageGasSpannedBilled] (@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,@TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage)
	
	--	Derive the net changes to avoid rounding errors
	set @ThermsMonthlyLastPeriod = @Therms - @ThermsMonthlySum
	set @CCFMonthlyLastPeriod = @CCF  - @CCFMonthlySum
	
	--	Create a custom note that explains how the information was parsed and what was the original information of the spanned row.
	--	It will note in EC3 that the transaction was derived.
	select @Notes = 'CalcTherm '+CAST(@Therms AS VARCHAR(10))+' = '+CAST(@ThermFactor AS VARCHAR(6))+' * '+CAST(@CCF AS VARCHAR(10))+
	' for '+CAST(@DeltaNumberOfPeriods AS VARCHAR(6))+' periods, First: '+@FirstPeriodCanceled +' ( '+@MeterFromReading+') Last: '+ 
	@BillingPeriodRevision +' ( '+@MeterToReading+'). '+' period: '+@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision+ ' Month %: '+CAST(@ApplyMonthlyPercentage AS VARCHAR(10))+
	' - Total %: '+CAST(@TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage AS VARCHAR(10))
	
	--	INSERT the data into the table "ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary"
	INSERT INTO ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary (
		AccountUtilityCompanySeqid,
		OriginalAccountNumber,
		OriginalMeterNumber,
		NumberOfTransactions, 
		NumberOfRebillTransactions,
		NumberOfCancelTransactions,
		BillingPeriod,
		BillingPeriodRevision,
		FirstCancelPeriod,
		BillingAction,
		InitialCancelFromDate,
		CurrentBillingToDate,
		GasRateCode,
		FromDate,
		ToDate,
		MeterFromReading,
		MeterToReading,
		Ccf,
		Therms,
		ThermsFactor,
		MeterConstant,
		TotalBillingDaysRebilled,
		NumberOfBillingPeriods,
		BillingDays,
		BillingDate,
		ReadingCode,
		NumberOfDials,
		MeterType,
		ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod,
		ProcessEffectiveDate,
		InitialPostingDate,
		AuthenticatedUserID,
		Notes,
		DerivedFromSpannedBill,
		SpannedBillingPeriodRevision,
		SpannedFirstCanceledBillingPeriod,
		SpannedCCF,
		SpannedThermFactor,
		SpannedTherm,
		SpannedMonthlyPercentage,
		SpannedTotalPercentage,
		EstimatedOrActualBilling,
		FacilityName,
		ServiceAddress)
	SELECT @ConEdUtilityCode,
		@AccountNumber,
		@OriginalMeterNumber, 
		1,-- NumberOfTransactions, 
		1,-- NumberOfRebillTransactions,
		0,-- NumberOfCancelTransactions,
		@BillingPeriod, 
		@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,
		@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,
		CASE WHEN @BillingPeriod = @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision THEN 'O' ELSE 'A' END,-- BillingAction, 
		@CalculatedFromDate,
		@CalculatedToDate,
		@GasRateCode,
		@CalculatedFromDate,
		@CalculatedToDate,
		CAST(@CalculatedMeterFromReading AS VARCHAR(7)),  --dbo.MeterReadingNumber
		CAST(@CalculatedMeterToReading AS VARCHAR(7)),  --dbo.MeterReadingNumber
		@CCFMonthlyLastPeriod, 
		@ThermsMonthlyLastPeriod,
		@ThermFactor,
		@MeterConstant,
		dbo.CalculateNumberOfBillingDays(@CalculatedFromDate, @CalculatedToDate), 
		1, 
		dbo.CalculateNumberOfBillingDays(@CalculatedFromDate, @CalculatedToDate),
		@BillingDate, 
		@ReadingCode,
		@NumberOfDials,
		'G', -- MeterType,
		'N', --ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod
		dbo.ConvertDateToYYYYMMDD (GETDATE()), -- ProcessEffectiveDate
		getDate(), -- InitialPostingDate
		1, --	AuthenticatedUserID,
		@Notes,
		'Y', -- DerivedFromSpannedBill
		@BillingPeriodRevision,  -- SpannedBillingPeriodRevision
		@FirstPeriodCanceled,  -- SpannedFirstPeriodCanceled
		@CCF,  -- SpannedCCF
		@ThermFactor,  -- SpannedThermFactor
		@Therms,  -- SpannedTherms
		@ApplyMonthlyPercentage,  -- SpannedApplyMonthlyPercentage
		@TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage,  -- SpannedTotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage
		dbo.CalculateEstimatedOrActual(@ReadingCode, 9),
		FacilityName,
		ServiceAddress
	FROM ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpanned
	WHERE UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpannedSeqid = @UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpannedSeqid;

		--	Process the next row
		FETCH NEXT FROM SpannedGasBillCursor INTO @UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpannedSeqid
	END;

	CLOSE SpannedGasBillCursor;
	DEALLOCATE SpannedGasBillCursor;
END;
